channel.title: Making a site redirect like this
channel.description:
Hello,
If I had something at a site for example:
http://www.james.com/ ( and it had an index.php file )
and I wanted it to redirect to something like:
http://www.james.com/?c=1
How would I do it without it redirect looping as it is from the same index.php file?
Thanks

item.title: Making a site redirect like this
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:14, topic:258633”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=341526.msg2644233#msg2644233 date=1233104512]

He’s from moparscape. They can’t do shit on their own.

<!-- end of c=1 void -->

lmfao

I fucking lol’d.
[/quote]hahahahahaha lol, thats so funny?[/quote]I don’t even think the void keyword is used in PHP, lmfao.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a site redirect like this
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[code]<?php
if( $_GET[‘c’] != 1 && $_GET[‘i’] != 1 )
{
header(“location: {$_SERVER[‘php_self’]}?i=1”);
}
?>

<?php if($_GET['c'] == 1) { echo ' Free2pk Offical Client - www.free2pk.ultb.net
Free2pk Forums

Java is not installed on your machine or your browser does not allowed Java Applet to run

Get the latest Java technology at http://www.java.com/


'; } ?> <?php if($_GET['i'] == 1) { echo ' Select the client you wish to play on

Please select a client you wish you play on, and one more thing thank you for using are free services!


'; } ?>

[/code]

Pwnd:

http://moparisthebest.com/smf

its webdesign not runescape stuff

item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

ill show you look:

my client:

http://free2pk.ultb.net/client/

that redirects to: http://free2pk.ultb.net/client/?i=1

thats fine, but it keeps redirecting to ?i=1 so if you click the button which is meant to go to ?c=1 it goes back to ?i=1 you try… click it

item.title: Making a site redirect like this
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:258635”][php]<?php
if( $_GET[‘c’] != 1 )
{
header(“location: {$_SERVER[‘php_self’]}?c=1”);
}
?>[/php][/quote]

and how can i ignore that on certain php files for example, i want it to redirect the index.php page but not ?c=5 and its in the same php file.

Thanks

Read full topic
